metadata.Title: CVE-2019-2632 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium
metadata.Description:
Vulnerability in the MySQL Server component of Oracle MySQL (subcomponent:Server : Pluggable Auth). Supported versions that are affected are 5.7.25and prior and 8.0.15 and prior. Easily exploitable vulnerability allowsunauthenticated attacker with network access via multiple protocols tocompromise MySQL Server. Successful attacks of this vulnerability canresult in unauthorized access to critical data or complete access to allMySQL Server accessible data. CVSS 3.0 Base Score 7.5 (Confidentialityimpacts). CVSS Vector: (CVSS:3.0/AV:N/AC:L/PR:N/UI:N/S:U/C:H/I:N/A:N).

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-2632` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libmysqlclient20 - 5.7.26-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
mysql-client - 5.7.26-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
mysql-client-5.7 - 5.7.26-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
mysql-client-core-5.7 - 5.7.26-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
mysql-common - 5.7.26-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
mysql-server - 5.7.26-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
mysql-server-5.7 - 5.7.26-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
mysql-server-core-5.7 - 5.7.26-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
mysql-source-5.7 - 5.7.26-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
mysql-testsuite - 5.7.26-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
mysql-testsuite-5.7 - 5.7.26-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: mysql-5.7 package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.7.26-0ubuntu0.16.04.1').
